title: Chiral Condensates in the Light-Cone Vacuum
abstract: In light-cone quantization, the standard procedure to characterize the phases of a system by appropriate ground state expectation values fails. The light-cone vacuum is determined kinematically. We show that meaningful quantities which can serve as order parameters are obtained as expectation values of Heisenberg operators in the equal (light-cone) time limit. These quantities differ from the purely kinematical expectation values of the corresponding Schroedinger operators. For the Nambu--Jona-Lasinio and the Gross-Neveu model, we describe the spontaneous breakdown of chiral symmetry; we derive within light-cone quantization the corresponding gap equations and the values of the chiral condensate.
